column4: Is it possible/probable that a reason for xfce4 not being able to function correctly, is that the kernel is too out of date for the version of the xfce4 package?
because you got your kernel from the ubuntu repositories
then you shouldn't be asking the question in #ubuntu
Linux kelia 2.6.18-92.1.18.el5.028stab060.2xen #1 SMP Tue Jan 13 12:04:44 MSK 2009 i686 GNU/Linux
any particular reason you're running that?
sounds like you need a new vps
ubuntu makes modifications to the vanilla kernel
red hat does the same (i assume we're still talking about this?)
then ,they make sure that their respective packages run on their respective kernels
that something failed is no surprise, regardless of age or version
i juts got done explaining why it's obvious that nothing runs
because the ubuntu packages are made to run on and tested against the ubuntu kernel
which has code that is different from the red hat kernel
which... is what i just said
